item.title: 华尔街顶级银行刚刚放弃了一个曾经很受欢迎的联盟
item.description: 在短短一个月内，华尔街最大的银行退出了全球金融界最受欢迎的俱乐部之一。【原文：Within the span of a month, Wall Street’s biggest banks have quit what had been one of the most popular clubs inside global finance.】

item.title: 中国人民银行誓言为创新和消费提供更多支持
item.description: 中国央行表示，将加大对科技创新和刺激消费的金融支持力度，以继续努力恢复经济增长。【原文：China’s central bank said it will step up financial support for technology innovation and consumption stimulation as part of a continued effort to revive economic growth.】

item.title: 毛里求斯前中央银行行长在欺诈案调查中获准保释
item.description: 毛里求斯前中央银行行长 Harvesh Seegolam 在被法庭临时指控阴谋诈骗后，于周六获准保释。【原文：Mauritius’ former central bank governor Harvesh Seegolam was granted bail on Saturday after a provisional charge of conspiracy to defraud was lodged in court.】

item.title: 全球经济为 20 世纪 30 年代式单边主义做好准备
item.description: 中国本周决定让其货币兑美元汇率走软，突破其数周来一直捍卫的水平，这凸显出 2025 年汇率政策可能出现重大紧张局势。【原文：China’s decision this week to let its currency weaken against the dollar past a level it had defended for weeks highlights the potential for 2025 to see major tensions over exchange-rate policy.】

item.title: 天空电视台称，肖布鲁克所有者希望 2025 年上半年在伦敦上市
item.description: 据天空新闻（Sky News）援引知情人士的话报道，肖布鲁克集团（Shawbrook Group Plc）的所有者正在制定计划，将于今年上半年在伦敦上市。【原文：The owners of Shawbrook Group Plc are working on plans to list the UK lender in London in the first half of this year, Sky News reported, citing people close to the matter it didn’t identify.】

item.title: 中国河北省蔬菜市场火灾造成八人死亡
item.description: 河北省北部张家口市发生火灾，造成 8 人死亡，15 人受伤。【原文：A fire in Zhangjiakou City of the northern Hebei province killed eight people and left 15 others injured, the local government said on its official Wechat account.】

item.title: 英国央行称房贷经纪人让加息更痛苦
item.description: 英格兰银行的研究表明，在抵押贷款经纪人说服英国房主签署短期协议后，他们尤其容易受到利率上升的影响。【原文：British homeowners were left particularly exposed to rising interest rates after mortgage brokers convinced them to sign shorter-term deals, according to research by the Bank of England.】

item.title: 拜登将禁止在美国大西洋和太平洋的大片水域进行新的石油钻探
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将下令禁止在美国沿海约 6.25 亿英亩的土地上开发新的近海石油和天然气，禁止出售大西洋和太平洋水域以及墨西哥湾东部的钻井权。【原文：President Joe Biden is set to order a ban on new offshore oil and gas development across some 625 million acres of US coastal territory, ruling out the sale of drilling rights in Atlantic and Pacific waters as well as the eastern Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 汽车制造商降价躲避罚款，英国电动汽车销量激增
item.description: 上个月在英国注册的新车中，几乎每三辆就有一辆是全电动汽车，因为汽车制造商不断降低插电式车型的价格以避免罚款。【原文：Almost one in three new cars registered in the UK last month were fully electric as automakers keep slashing prices of plug-in models to avoid fines.】

item.title: 司法部请求最高法院驳回特朗普推迟 TikTok 禁播令的申请
item.description: 拜登政府建议最高法院驳回唐纳德-特朗普的请求，即推迟实施一项法律，如果 TikTok 不是由其中国母公司销售，则禁止其在美国销售。【原文：The Biden administration suggested that the Supreme Court should reject Donald Trump’s request to delay a law that would ban TikTok in the US if it isn’t sold by its Chinese parent company.】

item.title: 肖尔茨校长应对马斯克攻击的秘诀："保持冷静
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）表示，最近埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对他和德国其他一些主要政治家的攻击并不影响他和国家的民主。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said recent attacks from Elon Musk on him and some of the country’s other leading politicians don’t affect him or the nation’s democracy.】

item.title: 日本的拒绝表明国家安全随心所欲
item.description: (彭博社）— 几个月来，美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.）一直认为，出售给日本新日铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）却不这么认为，他认为即使由一家位于亲密盟友日本的公司收购，也不足以消除对国家安全的担忧。【原文：(Bloomberg) — For months, United States Steel Corp. argued that selling out to Japanese-owned Nippon Steel Corp. was the only way to survive. President Joe Biden thought different, concluding that even a takeover by a company based in close ally Japan wasn’t enough to allay national-security concerns.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒表示对近期通胀 "反弹 "持谨慎态度
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，美国经济在今年年底形势良好，但她指出，她希望确认通胀再次步入下降通道。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said the US economy is ending the year in a good place, but noted she’d like to confirm inflation is once again on a downward path.】

item.title: 华尔街新年焦虑周风险偏好减弱
item.description: 日历的翻动是展望未来的时刻。对于新年的华尔街来说，对未来的判断是惶恐不安的。【原文：The turning of the calendar is an occasion to look ahead. For Wall Street at New Year’s, the verdict on the future is one of trepidation.】

item.title: 去年 ETF 基金规模突破 5000 亿加元，加拿大企业搭乘美股上涨快车
item.description: 2024 年，加拿大交易所交易基金的资产首次超过 5000 亿加元（约合 3460 亿美元），这一年的资金流入量和新基金发行量都打破了记录。【原文：Assets in Canadian exchange-traded funds surpassed C$500 billion ($346 billion) for the first time in 2024, a year that smashed records for inflows and new fund launches.】

item.title: 债券支付压力增大，债券买家寄希望于 "一月效应
item.description: 2024 年的债券市场以下跌告终。但至少在国家和地方政府债务方面，投资者有理由认为 1 月份会好一些。【原文：The bond market ended 2024 on a down note. But when it comes to state and local government debt, at least, investors have one reason to think January will be better.】

item.title: 零日期权在 S&P 500 指数中最受欢迎，主导地位日益增强
item.description: 第四季度，S&P 500 指数的零日期权首次超过了所有其他到期期权的总和，这是短期合约日益占据主导地位的最新里程碑。【原文：Zero-day options on the S&P 500 Index surpassed all other expirations combined in the fourth quarter for the first time ever, the latest milestone to mark the growing dominance of the short-term contracts.】

item.description: 微软公司计划在本财年斥资 800 亿美元建设数据中心，这凸显了人工智能对资金的巨大需求。【原文：Microsoft Corp. plans to spend $80 billion this fiscal year building out data centers, underscoring the intense capital requirements of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Getty Images 探索与竞争对手 Shutterstock 合并
item.description: 据知情人士透露，盖蒂图片控股公司（Getty Images Holdings Inc.Getty Images 的涨幅高达 32%。【原文：Getty Images Holdings Inc. is exploring a merger with rival Shutterstock Inc., according to people familiar with the matter. Getty Images rose as much as 32%.】

item.title: AQR 多元投资基金 2024 年股票和宏观收益回报率为 15
item.description: AQR 资本管理公司（AQR Capital Management）的多策略产品在 2024 年的回报率达到 15.1%，在股市中获得了巨大收益，尽管联合创始人克里夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）重申了他对 "史诗级 "估值的警告。【原文：AQR Capital Management’s multistrategy offering notched a 15.1% return in 2024, scoring big gains in the stock market even as co-founder Cliff Asness reiterated his warnings about “epic” valuations.】

item.title: 内德-戴维斯警告称下跌后可能会削减对美国股票的投资
item.description: 一年多来，Ned Davis Research 一直对美国股市持看涨建议，但如果过去一个月的疲软态势持续下去，这一建议可能很快就会改变。【原文：Ned Davis Research has kept a bullish recommendation toward US equities for more than a year, but that may change soon if the weakness seen over the past month persists.】

item.title: 阿根廷公布 5 家 "一线 "银行 10 亿美元回购额度
item.description: 阿根廷中央银行周五与五家国际贷款机构就一项价值 10 亿美元的回购协议达成协议，该协议将有助于补充阿根廷中央银行的外汇储备。【原文：Argentina’s central bank reached an agreement Friday with five international lenders on a $1 billion repurchase agreement that would help replenish the central bank’s foreign reserves.】

item.title: 无论谁当总统，大黑客都在不断攻击美国
item.description: 2024 年 12 月 16 日星期一，美国华盛顿特区白宫东厅，负责网络和新兴技术的副国家安全顾问安妮-纽伯格（Anne Neuberger）在光明节节日招待会上。根据一份给盟友的备忘录，美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）计划在其执政的最后几周就土地保护、宽大处理和人工智能等问题采取行动，他希望在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trumps）就职前编纂他的遗产。【原文：Anne Neuberger, deputy national security advisor for cyber and emerging technologies, during a Hanukkah holiday reception in the East Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Dec. 16, 2024. US President Joe Biden plans to take action on land protections, clemency and artificial intelligence in the final weeks of his administration, according to a memo to allies, as he looks to codify his legacy before Donald Trumps inauguration.】

item.title: 伟大的交易特鲁多的保守党竞争对手向特朗普推销能源
item.description: 自赢得美国大选以来，唐纳德-特朗普一直在嘲讽加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多，称他为美国第51个州的州长，威胁要征收25%的关税，并发泄美国因贸易逆差而被北方邻国宰割的不满。【原文：Since winning the US election, Donald Trump has taunted Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau by calling him governor of a 51st US state, threatened 25% tariffs, and vented that the US is getting ripped off by its northern neighbor because of a trade deficit.】

item.title: 失败交易激增显示 20 年期美国债券持续短缺
item.description: 20 年期美债再次绊住了回购市场交易员的脚步，回购市场是参与者借出和借入国债的地方。【原文：The 20-year US bond is again tripping up traders in the repo market, where participants lend and borrow Treasuries.】

item.title: 纽约期铜在每磅 4 美元上方徘徊，吸引买家
item.description: 伦敦和纽约的期铜走高，因为在全球需求强劲的忧虑加剧引发一连串下跌之后，出现了买盘兴趣的初步迹象。【原文：Copper futures edged higher in London and New York as tentative signs of buying interest emerged following a string of losses sparked by growing worries about the strength of global demand.】

item.title: 加密货币登陆华盛顿，成为不那么统一的政治力量
item.description: 过去几周，从硅谷到华盛顿，加密行业一直在取得胜利。随着一位支持加密货币的当选总统、一位新的人工智能和加密货币沙皇以及证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）的即将离职，数字资产在美国的未来从未像现在这样充满希望。【原文：Over the last few weeks, the crypto industry has been doing victory laps from Silicon Valley to Washington. With a pro-crypto president-elect, a new AI and crypto czar, and the pending exit of Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler, the future of digital assets in the US has never looked more promising.】
